title: datasets must not be named 'here'?! (not really, but probably some race condition)
body:
Check this out:

```
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp % DATALAD_REPO_VERSION=6 datalad install -s https://github.com/datalad/testrepo--minimalds.git mad
[INFO   ] Cloning https://github.com/datalad/testrepo--minimalds.git [1 other candidates] into '/tmp/mad' 
[INFO   ]   Remote origin not usable by git-annex; setting annex-ignore                      
install(ok): /tmp/mad (dataset)
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp % cd mad
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp/mad (git)-[master] % git st
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean
```

but with a simple name change

```
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp % DATALAD_REPO_VERSION=6 datalad install -s https://github.com/datalad/testrepo--minimalds.git here
[INFO   ] Cloning https://github.com/datalad/testrepo--minimalds.git [1 other candidates] into '/tmp/here' 
[INFO   ]   Remote origin not usable by git-annex; setting annex-ignore                      
install(ok): /tmp/here (dataset)
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp % cd here
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp/here (git)-[master] % git st
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

        modified:   CHANGELOG.md
        modified:   ingit/animated.gif

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp/here (git)-[master] % git st
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

        modified:   ingit/animated.gif

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
```

given that the git status report changes without any interaction, I suspect there is something funky going on in a smudge filter.

It is actually worse that just that:

```
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp/here (git)-[master] % git checkout ingit/animated.gif
(datalad3-dev) mih@meiner /tmp/here (git)-[master] % git st
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

        modified:   ingit/animated.gif

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
```
I stumbled upon this while investigating: https://travis-ci.org/datalad/datalad-htcondor/jobs/456354869

So it is unlikely that the name is the cause here, I actually tried it with 'mad' again, and it showed the same buggy behavior.

## git-annex
- version: 6.20181011+git124-g94aa0e2f6-1~ndall+1
## datalad 
  - full_version: 0.11.0.dev92-g82aef
